response_metadata.response_text:
{
"overview": "The Department of the Attorney General supports the bill and requests it be amended to include \"eight new claims were resolved that total $1,285,077.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt)\" (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). With the addition of these claims, the total number of claims in the bill is now thirty-one. The purpose of the bill remains to \"seek appropriations to satisfy claims against the State, its officers, or its employees\" (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt).",
"appropriations": "The Department of the Attorney General requests that the bill be amended to increase the requested appropriation by $1,285,077.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) for eight new claims. Including the new claims, the total appropriation request is $7,854,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). The updated request is for an appropriation of $6,444,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) from the general fund and $1,410,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) from departmental funds.",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "",
"agency_impact": "The Senate Committee on Ways and Means \"received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of Transportation, Department of Education, Attorney General, and Department of Hawaiian Home Lands\" (HB990_SD1_SSCR1686_.HTM.txt). The Hawaii State Department of Education supports the measure, stating it \"enables timely resolution of legal obligations, preventing unnecessary litigation and financial burdens\" (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). The Department of Hawaiian Home Lands also supports the bill, noting that resolving these cases will allow the department to \"focus on its mission to develop and deliver land to native Hawaiians\" (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt).",
"economic_impact": "",
"policy_impact": "",
"revenue_sources": "The Department of the Attorney General testimony indicates that seven of the eight new claims, totaling $1,215,077.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), are requested to be paid from the general fund. One new claim for $70,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) is requested to be paid from departmental funds. The updated total appropriation request includes $6,444,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) from the general fund for twenty-seven claims and $1,410,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) from departmental funds for four claims.",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "The Department of the Attorney General requests adding eight new claims totaling $1,285,077.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). From the general fund, these claims include settlements for Jon R. Chung v. State of Hawaii for $298,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), Kamaka Air, LLC for $512,700.83 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), and Anela Aplaca v. State of Hawaii for $70,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). Also included is a judgment for John Roe No. 121 v. State of Hawaii for $115,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). Three miscellaneous general fund claims are for the reissuance of outdated checks for National Commerce Bank Service for $166,492.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), Olinda Country Estates, Inc. for $50,210.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), and Sofia Lerman Estate for $22,674.17 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). One new claim is to be paid from departmental funds, a settlement for Susanna Sigal v. State of Hawaii for $70,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). With these additions, the appropriation request totals $7,854,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) allocated among thirty-one claims.",
"operating_revenue_impact": "",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The Department of the Attorney General has requested the addition of eight new claims resolved since the bill was last amended, increasing the total number of claims from twenty-three to thirty-one. This addition increases the total requested appropriation by $1,285,077.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), bringing the new total to $7,854,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). The updated request alters the funding distribution to $6,444,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) from the general fund and $1,410,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) from departmental funds."
}

State of Hawaii for $115,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). Three miscellaneous general fund claims are for the reissuance of outdated checks for National Commerce Bank Service for $166,492.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), Olinda Country Estates, Inc. for $50,210.67 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt), and Sofia Lerman Estate for $22,674.17 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). One new claim is to be paid from departmental funds, a settlement for Susanna Sigal v. State of Hawaii for $70,000.00 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt). With these additions, the appropriation request totals $7,854,458.74 (HB990_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_04-01-25_.PDF.txt) allocated among thirty-one claims.",

SNIFFEN DIRECTOR KA LUNA HOʻOKELE Deputy Directors Nā Hope Luna Hoʻokele DREANALEE K. KALILI TAMMY L. LEE CURT T. OTAGURO ROBIN

DREANALEE K. KALILI TAMMY L. LEE CURT T. OTAGURO ROBIN K. SHISHIDO April 1, 2025 10:01a.m. State Capitol, Room 211 & Videoconference H.B. 990, H.D. 2, S.D. 1 MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR CLAIMS AGAINST THE STATE, ITS OFFICERS, OR ITS EMPLOYEES Senate Committee on Ways and Means Committee The Hawaii Department

Senate Committee on Ways and Means Committee The Hawaii Department of Transportation supports H.B. 990, H.D. 2, S.D. 1 that authorizes judgements and settlements for claims against the State. We want to thank the State Attorney General office for all their support and hard work on completing these cases for

their support and hard work on completing these cases for the HDOT. Thank you for the opportunity to provide testimony. JOSH GREEN, M.D. GOVERNOR STATE OF HAWAI`I DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION KA ‘OIHANA HO‘ONA‘AUAO P.O. BOX 2360 HONOLULU, HAWAI`I 96804 KEITH T. HAYASHI SUPERINTENDENT Date: 04/01/2025 Time: 10:01 AM Location: CR

T. HAYASHI SUPERINTENDENT Date: 04/01/2025 Time: 10:01 AM Location: CR 211 & Videoconference Committee: Senate Ways and Means Department: Education Person Testifying: Keith T. Hayashi, Superintendent of Education Bill Title: HB 0990, HD2, SD1 MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR CLAIMS AGAINST THE STATE, ITS OFFICERS, OR ITS EMPLOYEES. Purpose of Bill: Makes

STATE, ITS OFFICERS, OR ITS EMPLOYEES. Purpose of Bill: Makes appropriations and approves payments for claims against the State, its officers, and its employees. Effective 4/23/2057. (SD1) Department's Position: The Hawaii State Department of Education (Department) supports HB990, HD2, SD1, which appropriates funds to satisfy claims against the State. This

which appropriates funds to satisfy claims against the State. This measure enables timely resolution of legal obligations, preventing unnecessary litigation and financial burdens. By settling claims efficiently, this bill allows the Department to focus on its core mission of educating Hawaii's students. Appropriating these funds ensures fiscal responsibility and protects

Hawaii's students. Appropriating these funds ensures fiscal responsibility and protects essential educational resources. Thank you for the opportunity to provide testimony in support of this measure. WRITTEN TESTIMONY OF THE DEPARTMENT OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL KA ‘OIHANA O KA LOIO KUHINA THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 ON THE FOLLOWING MEASURE: H.B. NO.

KUHINA THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 ON THE FOLLOWING MEASURE: H.B. NO. 990, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR CLAIMS AGAINST THE STATE, ITS OFFICERS, OR ITS EMPLOYEES. BEFORE THE: SENATE COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS DATE: Tuesday, April 1, 2025 TIME: 10:01 a.m. LOCATION: State Capitol, Room 211 TESTIFIER(S): WRITTEN

TIME: 10:01 a.m. LOCATION: State Capitol, Room 211 TESTIFIER(S): WRITTEN TESTIMONY ONLY. (For more information, contact Skyler G. Cruz, Deputy Attorney General, at (808) 586-1494) Chair Dela Cruz and Members of the Committee: The Department of the Attorney General (Department) supports this bill. The purpose of this bill is to

supports this bill. The purpose of this bill is to seek appropriations to satisfy claims against the State, its officers, or its employees, including claims for legislative relief, judgments against the State, settlements, and miscellaneous claims. The bill contains twenty-three claims that total $6,569,381.07. To satisfy this total amount, the

claims that total $6,569,381.07. of $1,340,000.00, allocated among three claims to be paid from departmental funds. Attachment "A" provides a brief description of each claim in this bill. these additional claims, the Department requests that the bill be amended to increase the requested appropriation by the amount of $1,285,077.67 allocated among eight claims as follows: • An appropriation in the amount of $1,215,077.67, allocated among seven claims to be paid from the general fund; and Written Testimony of

be paid from the general fund; and Written Testimony of the Department of the Attorney General Thirty-Third Legislature, 2025 Page 2 of 13 • An appropriation in the amount of $70,000.00, allocated to one claim to be paid from departmental funds. funds. Attachment "B" provides a brief description of the new claims. Including the new claims, the appropriation request totals $7,854,458.74 allocated among thirty-one claims, with the updated appropropriation request as follows: • An appropriation in the amount of $6,444,458.74, allocated among twenty- seven claims to be paid from the general

among twenty- seven claims to be paid from the general fund; and • An appropriation in the amount of $1,410,000.00, allocated among four claims to be paid from departmental funds. The Department has a longstanding policy of advising agencies as to how to avoid claims such as those in this

to how to avoid claims such as those in this bill. The Department has complied with section 37- 77.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes (HRS), which requires the Attorney General to develop and implement a procedure for advising our client agencies on how to avoid future claims. We respectfully request pas

SSCR1686 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1686 Honolulu, Hawaii RE: H.B. No. 990 H.D. 2 S.D. 1 Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Sir: Your Committee on Ways and Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 990, H.D. 2,

Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 990, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR CLAIMS AGAINST THE STATE, ITS OFFICERS, OR ITS EMPLOYEES," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to make appropriations and approve payments

of this measure is to make appropriations and approve payments for claims against the State, state officers, and state employees. Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the Department of Transportation, Department of Education, Attorney General, and Department of Hawaiian Home Lands. Your Committee finds that

and Department of Hawaiian Home Lands. Your Committee finds that appropriating moneys and authorizing the efficient settlement of claims will promote financial responsibility and allow state agencies to focus on their core missions. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Ways and Means

of the members of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 990, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the
Reading. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Ways and Means, ________________________________ DONOVAN M. DELA CRUZ, Chair
